ai.summary: A short, easy circular hike around the Erewash area in the UK. At 2.2 km, it’s suitable for families and casual walkers, with gentle terrain and minimal ascent.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat or gently rolling paths, combining grassy tracks and a few paved sections. Expect occasional puddles after rain; suitable for all-weather footwear.
ai.safety_notes: This is a short route with minimal elevation, but still follow safety basics. Stay on established paths; watch for other pedestrians and cyclists on shared sections; be mindful of road crossings; check weather and daylight hours; bring water and a light layer.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or light hiking boots
Weather-appropriate layer (waterproof jacket if rain is expected)
Map or offline navigation (or fully charged phone with GPS)
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the best conditions typically in spring to autumn.
